title: Chinchompa (Hunter)

properties.value: The chinchompa is a chinchompa that players can capture with the Hunter skill at level 53 or above and the completion of Eagles' Peak, granting 198.4 Hunter experience.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Chinchompa (Hunter)
This article is about the Hunter creature. For the explosive Ranged weapon, see Chinchompa.
 This article has a money making guide: Hunting chinchompas.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.

The chinchompa is a chinchompa that players can capture with the Hunter skill at level 53 or above and the completion of Eagles' Peak, granting 198.4 Hunter experience.

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 Hunter info
  • 3 Hunting technique
    • 3.1 Hunting chance
  • 4 Uses
  • 5 References

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Piscatoris Hunter area122Maplink
Kourend Woodland14Maplink
Isle of Souls15Maplink

Hunter info[edit | edit source]

Chinchompa
Level required 53
Hunter XP198.4 xp
RetaliationYes
TrapBox trap
Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Chinchompa1Always76984

Hunting technique[edit | edit source]

The hunting technique is the same as for other chinchompas. Players must bring a box trap for each trap they plan to set up. Players can use the same box trap over and over to catch multiple creatures.

Chinchompas can be attacked, but they will explode upon being killed, harming the player if they are standing right next to it for 2 damage. Accidental misclicks may be avoided by wielding a bow with no arrows or adjusting NPC attack options to right-click attack only.

A fast but more attention-needing method of catching chinchompas is the "stand and shoot" method. The player should equip a bow and about 1000+ arrows and figure out where one chinchompa respawns by killing one and seeing where it appears. Once the player knows the exact location where a chinchompa respawns, they should surround the square with their box traps. Then, as the chinchompa appears, it will either enter a trap, or it will dismantle all traps and hop away. If the chinchompa dismantles the traps, the player should immediately kill it with an arrow and set the traps up again as fast as possible. In about three to four seconds, the chinchompa will respawn again, and the player may repeat the process of "standing and shooting" if necessary. This method has been tested to be more experience per hour than the traditional "set-up traps and wait" method, because the player can just make the chinchompa respawn and make it more likely to enter a trap rather than wait while it wanders around.

Hunting chance[edit | edit source]

The chance of success is approximately 145/255 beginning at level 53, and 268/255 at level 99.[1] The approximate formula for the chance of a successful catch (P) given hunter level (L) is:

P ( L ) = ( ⌊ 262 × ( L − 1 ) 98 ⌋ + 6 ) ÷ 255 {\displaystyle P(L)=(\lfloor {\frac {262\times (L-1)}{98}}\rfloor +6)\div 255}

Uses[edit | edit source]

Chinchompas are multi-target stackable Ranged weapons requiring level 45 Ranged to wield, which can hit up to 9 targets in a 3x3 area.

==Hunting technique==
The hunting technique is the same as for other chinchompas. Players must bring a [[box trap]] for each trap they plan to set up. Players can use the same box trap over and over to catch multiple creatures.

Chinchompas can be attacked, but they will explode upon being killed, harming the player if they are standing right next to it for 2 damage. Accidental misclicks may be avoided by wielding a [[bow]] with no [[arrows]] or adjusting NPC attack options to right-click attack only.

A fast but more attention-needing method of catching chinchompas is the "stand and shoot" method. The player should equip a bow and about 1000+ arrows and figure out where one chinchompa respawns by killing one and seeing where it appears. Once the player knows the exact location where a chinchompa respawns, they should surround the square with their box traps. Then, as the chinchompa appears, it will either enter a trap, or it will dismantle all traps and hop away. If the chinchompa dismantles the traps, the player should immediately kill it with an arrow and set the traps up again as fast as possible. In about three to four seconds, the chinchompa will respawn again, and the player may repeat the process of "standing and shooting" if necessary. This method has been tested to be more experience per hour than the traditional "set-up traps and wait" method, because the player can just make the chinchompa respawn and make it more likely to enter a trap rather than wait while it wanders around.

===Hunting chance===
The chance of success is approximately 145/255 beginning at level 53, and 268/255 at level 99.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/646649948738617344|date=23 September 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/bRR6z|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=For greys, it's 6/255 at level 1 and 268/255 at level 99; interpolate between those. Red & blacks use -78-228 /255.}} The approximate formula for the chance of a successful catch (P) given hunter level (L) is:

<math>
P(L) = (\lfloor\frac{262 \times (L-1)}{98}\rfloor + 6) \div 255
</math>
